intro: Banksia erythrocephala var. erythrocephala, commonly known as the red-headed banksia, is a flowering plant native to southwestern Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive red flower spikes that contrast with its grey-green foliage. The plant belongs to the Proteaceae family and is well adapted to the region's Mediterranean climate. Its woody structure and fire-resistant properties make it a resilient species in its native habitat. The flowers attract nectar-feeding birds and insects, contributing to its ecological significance.
